page.title: 07Rowhurst Forge Leatherhead
page.content: Rowhurst Forge was built in 1950 of old materials to match the adjacent Tudor farmhouse. Most of the work is done in mild steel which is obtained from the British Steel Industry but when they are on strike it is imported from Sweden. A few items are made in stainless steel which is more expensive. A lot of this work is exported to Saudi Arabia for the Sheik Of Oman's palace. The forge, which employs 20 people, is a member of the crafts council. Blacksmiths train for 5 yrs working a 37.5 hour week. At the forge there is an exhibition gallery where work from all over the world is on show. The 10 acres of land, which belong to the forge, are divided by the M25 motorway. The present owners are Mr and Mrs Quinnell.
